questiontext.text: Caps of Coke bottles vary slightly in diameter. Suppose you take two random samples of 40 and 60 caps, respectively. Do they have the same distribution?

answer.text: Yes, they have the same means and standard errors.

feedback.text: Yes, they have the same averages and standard errors…: Incorrect

answer.text: No, the sample of 40 caps has a larger mean and standard error than the sample of 60.

feedback.text: No, the sample of 40 caps has a larger mean and standard error than the sample of 60…: Incorrect

answer.text: No, the sample of 60 caps has a larger mean and standard error than the sample of 40.

feedback.text: No, the sample of 60 caps has a larger mean and standard error than the sample of 40: Incorrect

answer.text: No, they have different means and standard errors.

feedback.text: No, they have different means and standard errors…: Incorrect

answer.text: No, they have the same means but different standard errors.

feedback.text: No, they have the same means but different standard errors…: Correct
